resources: "A Opportunity cost is equal to total revenue minus total variable cost. ENDSTOPB Opportunity cost is constant. ENDSTOPC Opportunity cost is the cost in terms of the best foregone alternative. ENDSTOPD Opportunity cost is the addition to total cost of producing one extra unit of a good." "A a decrease in labour productivity in industry X ENDSTOPB a fall in the price of raw materials used to produce Good X ENDSTOPC a decrease in wages in industry X ENDSTOPD a government subsidy on the production of Good X" "A the demand for Good X to fall and price of Good X to fall ENDSTOPB the demand for Good X to fall and price of Good X to rise ENDSTOPC the demand for Good X to rise and price of Good X to fall ENDSTOPD the demand for Good X to rise and price of Good X to rise" "A people who know they are a bad risk are more inclined to take out insurance. ENDSTOPB people who know they are a bad risk are less inclined to take out insurance. ENDSTOPC a policyholder may act in a way which makes an insured event less likely to occur. ENDSTOPD a policyholder may act in a way which makes an insured event more likely to occur." "A raise their price in the short run but restore the price back to its original level in the long run. ENDSTOPB keep their price constant in both the short run and the long run. ENDSTOPC raise their price in both the short run and the long run. ENDSTOPD keep their price constant in the short run but raise their price in the long run." "A marginal cost curve cuts the demand curve. ENDSTOPB marginal cost curve cuts the marginal revenue curve. ENDSTOPC average cost curve cuts the marginal revenue curve. ENDSTOPD average cost curve cuts the demand curve." "A significant economies of scale ENDSTOPB heavy potential advertising costs ENDSTOPC large capital requirements ENDSTOPD constant returns to scale" "A £15,000 ENDSTOPB £12,000 ENDSTOPC £7,000 ENDSTOPD not possible to calculate from the information given" "A Under perfect competition, in the long run all firms produce where marginal costs equal average revenue. ENDSTOPB Under monopolistic competition firms produce differentiated products. ENDSTOPC Under oligopoly, firms make decisions taking into account the possible reactions of their competitors. ENDSTOPD Under monopoly, a profit maximising firm with positive marginal costs always produces in the region of price inelastic demand." "A attempts to maximise sales after assuming that the other firm will attempt to maximise sales. ENDSTOPB assumes the other firm will produce a given output and then chooses its profit maximising output. ENDSTOPC assumes the other firm’s price is given and then chooses its profit maximising price. ENDSTOPD will attempt to collude with the other firm so as to set a price and output level which will maximise industry level profits." "A The launch phase ENDSTOPB The growth phase ENDSTOPC The innovation phase ENDSTOPD The decline phase" "A Tier 1 plus Tier 2 capital divided by total assets ENDSTOPB Tier 1 plus Tier 2 capital divided by risk weighted assets ENDSTOPC Tier 1 capital divided by total assets ENDSTOPD Tier 1 capital divided by risk weighted assets" "A a rise in the average price of exports relative to the average price of imports ENDSTOPB a rise in the average price of imports relative to the average price of exports ENDSTOPC an appreciation of the domestic currency ENDSTOPD a rise in the domestic country’s terms of trade index from 100 to 120" "A expansionary fiscal policy ENDSTOPB expansionary monetary policy ENDSTOPC better education and training ENDSTOPD a reduction in trade union powers" "A Gross Domestic Product is greater than Gross National Income. ENDSTOPB Gross Domestic Product is less than Gross National Income. ENDSTOPC Gross Domestic Product is the same as Gross National Income. ENDSTOPD we cannot say whether Gross Domestic Product differs from Gross National Income from this information." "A 4.76% ENDSTOPB 5.0% ENDSTOPC 6.25% ENDSTOPD 6.67%" "A an increase in interest rates ENDSTOPB a depreciation in its exchange rate ENDSTOPC a fall in government expenditure ENDSTOPD a decrease in business confidence" "A the annual cycle of output. ENDSTOPB the long run trend path of output after removing short run variations. ENDSTOPC the periodic fluctuations of output around the long run trend. ENDSTOPD none of the above." "A lenders will gain at the expense of borrowers and employers will gain at the expense of workers. ENDSTOPB lenders will gain at the expense of borrowers and workers will gain at the expense of employers. ENDSTOPC borrowers will gain at the expense of lenders and employers will gain at the expense of workers. ENDSTOPD borrowers will gain at the expense of lenders and workers will gain at the expense of employers." "A a rise in the value of the fiscal multiplier. ENDSTOPB a decrease in the transactions demand for money. ENDSTOPC a rise in the rate of interest. ENDSTOPD an increase in the speculative demand for money." "A give an actual rate of unemployment which is temporarily greater than the natural rate. ENDSTOPB give an actual rate of unemployment which is temporarily lower than the natural rate. ENDSTOPC increase the natural rate of unemployment. ENDSTOPD decrease the natural rate of unemployment." "A investment is determined by the rate of change of national income. ENDSTOPB national income is determined by the rate of change of investment. ENDSTOPC investment is increased when interest rates fall. ENDSTOPD national income is increased when interest rates fall." "A an expansionary fiscal policy. ENDSTOPB an expansionary monetary policy. ENDSTOPC a contractionary fiscal policy. ENDSTOPD a contractionary monetary policy." "A higher domestic interest rates and an appreciation of the domestic currency. ENDSTOPB higher domestic interest rates and a depreciation of the domestic currency. ENDSTOPC lower domestic interest rates and an appreciation of the domestic currency. ENDSTOPD lower domestic interest rates and a depreciation of the domestic currency." "A increases in social security benefits designed to increase expenditures of unemployed workers ENDSTOPB measures designed to increase trade union powers so that real wage rises can increase expenditures of employed workers ENDSTOPC increases in Tariffs designed to increase production of domestic goods ENDSTOPD reduction in corporate taxation" "A Exports become cheaper when measured in the foreign currency. ENDSTOPB Imports become more expensive when measured in the domestic currency. ENDSTOPC Export volumes will decrease. ENDSTOPD Import volumes will decrease."
